description: This .25 credit online course supports the curriculum of study abroad and away semester and
programs with Smith Center for Global Engagement-approved providers. It is not for students
who are going on faculty-led study abroad and away programs. Students read articles and chapters
intercultural communication, globalization, and identity. Students reflect on their experiences
in their study abroad or away location, discuss global systems that connect learning, and also
identity across borders. Course topics include identity, globalization, intercultural
communication, adjusting to a new environment, defining culture, and understanding through
intercultural practices. Offered fall and spring semesters. Prerequisite: registration in
study abroad or away semester or year-long program.
